keyMoments.title: Gomu Gomu no Hanabi: Ougon Botan Debut
keyMoments.description: Luffy uses the golden ball attached to his arm to perform a new variation of his Hanabi technique, destroying Enel's Raigo thundercloud by using it as an electrical conductor.
keyMoments.significance: This technique saves Skypiea from destruction and demonstrates Luffy's ability to turn Enel's trap into a weapon.
keyMoments.quote: Gomu Gomu no Hanabi: Ougon Botan!

keyMoments.title: Luffy's Inner Thoughts Heard for First Time
keyMoments.description: For the first time in the entire series, Luffy's inner thoughts are revealed as he reflects on Conis' tears and Aisa's fears about Skypiea disappearing.
keyMoments.significance: This extremely rare narrative moment highlights Luffy's empathy and the emotional weight of his fight to save Skypiea.

keyMoments.title: Gomu Gomu no Ougon Rifle Defeats Enel
keyMoments.description: Luffy delivers a devastating finishing blow to Enel using the golden ball and his twisted arm. The attack's speed exceeds even Enel's Mantra-enhanced reactions, sending him crashing into the Golden Bell.
keyMoments.significance: This technique defeats the tyrannical god Enel and ends his reign over Skypiea while ringing the Golden Bell.

keyMoments.title: Rings the Golden Bell
keyMoments.description: Luffy's punch sends Enel into the Golden Bell, causing it to ring for the first time in 400 years and proving the existence of the City of Gold.
keyMoments.significance: Fulfills a 400-year-old promise, vindicates Noland's legacy, and brings peace to Skypiea.

abilities.abilityName: Gomu Gomu no Hanabi: Ougon Botan
abilities.description: Luffy spins his body around while colliding the large golden ball attached to his arm with a thundercloud, using it as an electrical conductor to destroy the cloud.

Similar to Gomu Gomu no Rifle but with the golden ball attached to his arm, possessing much more speed and creating a massive sonic boom. Fast enough that even lightning-speed opponents cannot dodge it.

reveals.information: Luffy's inner thoughts are heard for the first time, revealing his empathy for Conis and Aisa

keyMoments.title: 200,000,000 Volt Amaru Transformation
keyMoments.description: Enel transforms into his ultimate state, becoming a huge Raijin-like lightning figure at maximum voltage, capable of firing enormous electrical bolts.
keyMoments.significance: Represents the full extent of Enel's Goro Goro no Mi powers, though it ultimately proves ineffective against Luffy.

keyMoments.title: Enel's Defeat
keyMoments.description: Enel is defeated by Luffy's Gomu Gomu no Ougon Rifle and knocked into the Golden Bell, ending his tyrannical reign over Skypiea.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the end of Enel's oppressive rule and the main conflict of the Skypiea Arc.

abilities.description: Enel's ultimate transformation where he morphs his entire body into a colossal lightning form at maximum voltage, becoming a huge potbellied Raijin-like figure capable of firing enormous electrical bolts.

reveals.information: Enel's ultimate form is the 200,000,000 Volt Amaru transformation

name.japanese: モンブラン・クリケット

keyMoments.title: Hears the Golden Bell from the Blue Sea
keyMoments.description: Cricket and the Saruyama Alliance hear the Golden Bell ring from Jaya, proving that the City of Gold exists in the sky and vindicating his ancestor Noland's legacy.
keyMoments.significance: Frees Cricket from the 400-year burden of proving his ancestor was not a liar. He bursts into tears of happiness knowing the truth and that the Straw Hats are alive.

reveals.information: The City of Gold is proven to exist in the sky, vindicating Mont Blanc Noland and freeing Cricket from his family's burden
